blog.name: lazydoodlesandfanfic
blog.title: ~Lazy Doodles and Fanfic~

title: Memory (Steve Rogers X Son!Reader)
body:
Characters: Steve Rogers X Son!Reader

Universe: Marvel, Avengers

Warnings: Spoilers to Infinity War, death of characters

SAD, ANGST AND FLUFF

Request: Could you do a Steve Rogers x son!reader based on the song Memory from Cats where it starts off really cute but then the reader loses his best friend (Peter) so he runs away, but after a little while comes back to Steve? An angst/fluff hybrid I guess lmao

Steve had a lot of things to think about. Wakanda had lost its king, he’s just lost his best friend all over again, as well as more friends, and he had just found out who else had died who weren’t in Wakanda.

When he saw Tony for the first time, he knew immediately who was missing, and it made his heart stop. “Is Peter…”

“Yeah. Yeah he’s gone. He went in my arms.” Tony said quickly, not wanting to talk too slowly in case he let his emotions spill out again. “What about Y/N…?” Tony asked in response. Steve gulped, feeling almost guilty.

“He’s okay…” He responded. Tony nodded, walking past his old friend, putting a hand on his shoulder, patting it before continuing on his way. While Steve was happy that his son was okay, he was worried about how he was going to tell you. How he was going to tell you that not only had your uncle that you’d started to grow close to, had died, countless friends but also your best friend, Peter.

He had flown to you. He kept his distance from you for your own safety when he became a fugitive and Tony had promised to help keep your new identity a secret. You had understood, and didn’t complain much since May had offered the spare room in the apartment to you, knowing that you were Peter’s best friend and Steve’s son. For the past few years you’d been under the fake identity of Peter’s cousin from another of May’s siblings that in reality, didn’t exist. This also meant you were especially close with Peter. This made it even harder.

Steve showed up at the door of May’s apartment, and as soon as she opened the door, the despair in her eyes was already there. He knew that she knew. But that now raised the question- did you know already?

“T-The news found out that Spiderman had died… overheard or something… Y/N ran out as soon as it was announced.” She explained. Steve frowned, looking down silently. May sniffed, but held her head high. “I just tried to call him, and he isn’t picking up his phone, I think you should go looking for him. Don’t worry about me… I’m tough, and I’ll know this’ll work out… somehow. Just go find your son.” She ordered at the captain. Steve nodded, giving a quick hug, before turning and leaving to find you.

He walked the streets of New York. No one stopped for autographs, or to take pictures, and no one turned to yell abuse or to call the cops since he was still technically a fugitive. They could see the injuries on his face and battered, altered uniform, and they all knew he’d done his best. They could also see in his eyes he wasn’t finished, and he was looking for something. Someone. So they weren’t going to slow the search. He walked block after block, not finding you, and part of him started to panic.

What if you were a late reaction?

Soon police stopped him, not arresting him, but telling him to go home. He responded by saying he’d be patrolling tomorrow, looking for his now missing son. They didn’t stop him.

The sight of Captain America walking around New York, patrolling was becoming a normal sight. It had been two weeks since Thanos snapped his fingers, and people were trying to pick up the pieces. Not to move on, but to get things up and running before things got even worse. It did make communities and families closer. Big, usually selfish companies were giving out large amounts purely to help people who had lost a lot- especially kids and parents who had lost each other. People had set up groups to look for people who were missing, due to people not know if they were a victim or not. Despite the close community, Steve still couldn’t find his son. By this point, your identity had been released, and Steve no longer walked alone. People walked with him, working as second eyes to look for you, but also others.

Steve was losing hope, and it was destroying him. He had lost everything, and the thought of losing his own son as well felt like too much. At least with Bucky, Wanda and Sam, he knew what happened. He saw what happened. He knows where they are. But he wasn’t there for you, and now he had no idea.

“Mr Rogers?” An officer interrupted the cycle this day. Steve turned to her, coming to a halt, but stepping closer to her, allowing the crowd of people also searching to continue walking.

“New files? Any found?” He asked, expecting to be handed new pictures of new faces hoping to be found. He was handed a picture, but the picture was familiar. It was your picture. “Officer, this is my son.” Steve told the officer, his voice shaking.

“I know. I found him.” The officer answered. Steve’s head shot up, seeing the hopeful smile on the officer’s face. Some of the crowd had heard, and had turn to see. She didn’t have to tell him to follow, both of them running through the streets of abandoned cars. People didn’t drive around New York. Cars were forced to the side and only buses and military trucks were used due to the amount of cars not being needed.

They came to one of the shelters set up in a bar to help the homeless and lost, and you stood out. You were sat at the bar, fiddling with your hands, wearing what Steve knew to be Peter’s jacket. “Y/N!” Steve called immediately, making you look up. Seeing your dad, you jumped from your seat, running and just hugging him tightly. “Thank god… I thought you were dead.” Steve sobbed. How could he not? He didn’t care that people saw the Captain cry, because right now he wasn’t the Captain. He was your father.

“I-is it true dad? Is Peter dead?” You asked, lifting your head at him. He frowned, kneeling down and nodding. He hated seeing his son cry. Seeing his child cry always broke his heart.

“And Bucky… and Wanda, Sam… but listen to me, okay?” Steve demanded. You looked back at him, continuing to cry, but listening. “This isn’t the end. Even if we can’t bring them back, we can make sure that bastard pays for what he’s done. We will find Thanos, and make him pay for what he’s done. I promise. We’ll get revenge for Peter, and everyone else Thanos killed.” He promised. When he first told his team this, he was far from convincing in his promise. But this time was different. Thanos hadn’t just hurt him. He’d hurt his son, and while the world can drag him through the mud all it wants, he sure as hell isn’t gonna let that happen to you. He felt the determination in his veins as he told you this, and even more when he hugged you.

Hope you like it! If you have any questions, please send them in! 

*Not my gif

TAGS: @dailyteambucky @mxrvelsaos @insanityismysanity12345 @abbybills22 @waywardemo @httpmcrvel @mutantjediavenger @theoraekensnotsosecretlover @imbuckypositive @gayasfridge @courtneychicken  @graysonmalfoy @bellero @captain-peanut-at-your-service @likiyoshi-lijie  @aesthetjic @originalpottervengerlock @supernatural-pan @esoltis280 @lena-stan-xavier @lady-of-lies @sebstanismylife

This made it even harder.

Steve showed up at the door of May’s apartment, and as soon as she opened the door, the despair in her eyes was already there. He knew that she knew. But that now raised the question- did you know already?

“T-The news found out that Spiderman had died… overheard or something… Y/N ran out as soon as it was announced.” She explained. Steve frowned, looking down silently. May sniffed, but held her head high. “I just tried to call him, and he isn’t picking up his phone, I think you should go looking for him. Don’t worry about me… I’m tough, and I’ll know this’ll work out… somehow. Just go find your son.” She ordered at the captain. Steve nodded, giving a quick hug, before turning and leaving to find you.

He walked the streets of New York. No one stopped for autographs, or to take pictures, and no one turned to yell abuse or to call the cops since he was still technically a fugitive. They could see the injuries on his face and battered, altered uniform, and they all knew he’d done his best. They could also see in his eyes he wasn’t finished, and he was looking for something. Someone. So they weren’t going to slow the search. He walked block after block, not finding you, and part of him started to panic.

What if you were a late reaction?

Soon police stopped him, not arresting him, but telling him to go home. He responded by saying he’d be patrolling tomorrow, looking for his now missing son. They didn’t stop him.

The sight of Captain America walking around New York, patrolling was becoming a normal sight. It had been two weeks since Thanos snapped his fingers, and people were trying to pick up the pieces. Not to move on, but to get things up and running before things got even worse. It did make communities and families closer. Big, usually selfish companies were giving out large amounts purely to help people who had lost a lot- especially kids and parents who had lost each other. People had set up groups to look for people who were missing, due to people not know if they were a victim or not. Despite the close community, Steve still couldn’t find his son. By this point, your identity had been released, and Steve no longer walked alone. People walked with him, working as second eyes to look for you, but also others.

Steve was losing hope, and it was destroying him. He had lost everything, and the thought of losing his own son as well felt like too much. At least with Bucky, Wanda and Sam, he knew what happened. He saw what happened. He knows where they are. But he wasn’t there for you, and now he had no idea.

“Mr Rogers?” An officer interrupted the cycle this day. Steve turned to her, coming to a halt, but stepping closer to her, allowing the crowd of people also searching to continue walking.

“New files? Any found?” He asked, expecting to be handed new pictures of new faces hoping to be found. He was handed a picture, but the picture was familiar. It was your picture. “Officer, this is my son.” Steve told the officer, his voice shaking.

“I know. I found him.” The officer answered. Steve’s head shot up, seeing the hopeful smile on the officer’s face. Some of the crowd had heard, and had turn to see. She didn’t have to tell him to follow, both of them running through the streets of abandoned cars. People didn’t drive around New York. Cars were forced to the side and only buses and military trucks were used due to the amount of cars not being needed.

They came to one of the shelters set up in a bar to help the homeless and lost, and you stood out. You were sat at the bar, fiddling with your hands, wearing what Steve knew to be Peter’s jacket. “Y/N!” Steve called immediately, making you look up. Seeing your dad, you jumped from your seat, running and just hugging him tightly. “Thank god… I thought you were dead.” Steve sobbed. How could he not? He didn’t care that people saw the Captain cry, because right now he wasn’t the Captain. He was your father.

“I-is it true dad? Is Peter dead?” You asked, lifting your head at him. He frowned, kneeling down and nodding. He hated seeing his son cry. Seeing his child cry always broke his heart.

“And Bucky… and Wanda, Sam… but listen to me, okay?” Steve demanded. You looked back at him, continuing to cry, but listening. “This isn’t the end. Even if we can’t bring them back, we can make sure that bastard pays for what he’s done. We will find Thanos, and make him pay for what he’s done. I promise. We’ll get revenge for Peter, and everyone else Thanos killed.” He promised. When he first told his team this, he was far from convincing in his promise. But this time was different. Thanos hadn’t just hurt him. He’d hurt his son, and while the world can drag him through the mud all it wants, he sure as hell isn’t gonna let that happen to you. He felt the determination in his veins as he told you this, and even more when he hugged you.

Hope you like it! If you have any questions, please send them in! 

*Not my gif

TAGS: @dailyteambucky @mxrvelsaos @insanityismysanity12345 @abbybills22 @waywardemo @httpmcrvel @mutantjediavenger @theoraekensnotsosecretlover @imbuckypositive @gayasfridge @courtneychicken  @graysonmalfoy @bellero @captain-peanut-at-your-service @likiyoshi-lijie  @aesthetjic @originalpottervengerlock @supernatural-pan @esoltis280 @lena-stan-xavier @lady-of-lies @sebstanismylife
trail.content_abstract:
Characters: Steve Rogers X Son!Reader

Universe: Marvel, Avengers

Warnings: Spoilers to Infinity War, death of characters

SAD, ANGST AND FLUFF

Request: Could you do a Steve Rogers x son!reader based on the song Memory from Cats where it starts off really cute but then the reader loses his best friend (Peter) so he runs away, but after a little while comes back to Steve? An angst/fluff hybrid I guess lmao

Steve had a lot of things to think about. Wakanda had lost its king, he’s just lost his best friend all over again, as well as more friends, and he had just found out who else had died who weren’t in Wakanda.

summary: There’s a big problem with masculinity and homosexuality that they can’t somehow go hand in hand. That we can’t have someone in...
text: There’s a big problem with masculinity and homosexuality that they can’t somehow go hand in hand. That we can’t have someone in a Marvel movie who’s gay in real life and plays some super hero. I mean, when is that going to happen?
source: Kit Harington complaining in Toronto about the lack of gay actors starring in superhero films. Quoted in Variety.

reblog.comment: Kit Harington complaining in Toronto about the lack of gay actors starring in superhero films. Quoted in Variety.
